net.javacoding.jspider.core.throttle
Interface Throttle

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimultaneousUsersThrottleImpl, DistributedLoadThrottleImpl
public interface Throttle

Interface that will be implemented upon all classes that will act as a throttle. This type of component will control the load put upon a certain host, thus keeping the spider threads from doing too much requests in a too short time frame.

If no throttling would be used, our JSpider engine could cause a DOS attack on the target machine.

Please remark that the throttling is done on a per-host base, not on a per-site base. This means that if you have 2 sites, eg:

  1. http://localhost:80/
  2. http://localhost:8080/
      3. and you would allow 2 hits/second by configuring a throttle, these sites would _together_ get 2 hits/second at max, because they're on the same machine. Two sites on a difference hostname are throttled independently of each other.

      $Id: Throttle.java,v 1.1 2002/11/20 17:26:09 vanrogu Exp $

      Author:
      Günther Van Roey

      Method Summary
       void throttle()
                Method to which a spider thread will be directed before making a call on a webserver.
       

      Method Detail

      throttle

      public void throttle()
      Method to which a spider thread will be directed before making a call on a webserver. This allows the throttle component implementation to hold the thread under control.
